attributes.action: Make on-line gambling illegal
attributes.background: 24-hour easy access to on-line gambling exacerbates the tragic results of people gambling beyond their means. Ban it completely, by making on-line gambling illegal in the UK
attributes.additional_details: The well-publicised explosion in on-line gambling illustrates how vast fortunes are made by small numbers of owners, at the expense of huge numbers of vulnerable gamblers, including the young and those who can ill afford to spend on gambling. Gambling profits come from one single source: the gamblers' losses. It causes hardship, family rifts, depression and suicides. On-line gambling specifically presents easy opportunities 24/7/365 for people to succumb to temptation to bet beyond their means, without even leaving their homes, and without regard for consequences. There is only one effective solution, which is to ban on-line gambling completely, by making it illegal in the UK

attributes.action: Water safety & effects of cold water to be taught to teenagers
attributes.background: In 2018 we have seen a increase in the amount of deaths in water from cold water shock and drowning, This increase is due to the hot weather we have had. This makes it more worrying that none really trains members of the community or school children on the dangers of open water and how to stay safe.
attributes.additional_details:
We really need to train youngsters and adults in the dangers of cold water shock, this can be triggered by jumping into the water which holds its temperature between 10 degrees - 15 degrees, 

The biggest danger is inhaling water and drowning, even if the water is flat, calm and you know how to swim. Cold Water Shock causes an immediate loss of breathing control. You take one or more huge gasps, followed by hyperventilation – very rapid breathing that is hard or impossible for you to control.

attributes.action: Review the use of Palm Oil in products consumed in the UK and it’s taxation.
attributes.background: Palm oil is widely used in everyday products, I believe more can be done to protect areas destroyed for palm oil plantations. I am requesting to UK to set the trend of reviewing the use and availability of palm oil including its taxation.

attributes.action: Minimum speed limit for motorways.
attributes.background: Make the minimum speed limit for cars on motorways to match the maximum speed for trucks. Cars travelling slower than trucks cause dangerous situations where the truck has to overtake or be forced to slow down. This is especially dangerous on two lane sections and in bad weather.

attributes.action: Protect British food and drink in future trade deals
attributes.background: I would like the Government to act now and introduce legislation that ensures protected designation of origin (PDO), protected geographical indication (PGI), and traditional specialities guaranteed (TSG), remain a part of the British food and drink industry post Brexit.
attributes.additional_details: I urge you to back British business and sign our petition that will help promote our vital food and drink industries.

attributes.action: Require school housing facilities (boarding houses) to provide recycling bins
attributes.background: Young minds should be taught the importance of protecting the planet so it is there for future generations.In the countryside the evidence of humans encroaching on the environment is very clear. Schools have the ability to change the minds of the future and should use this ability for our benefit.
attributes.additional_details: School’s with an average of 650 pupils plus staff produces a lot of waste annually. That waste should be disposed of correctly and safely.Up to 60% of the rubbish that ends up in the bin could be recycled and isn’t. Also, there is 260 million tons of plastic produced each year (globally), about 10 percent ends up in our oceans. This plastic can take between 450-1000 years to decompose.

attributes.action: All staff in semh schools to be MHFA trained and a minimum of 7 inset days.
attributes.background: SEMH schools have students with varying needs that are written into an EHCP. It's only right that adequate mandatory training is available to all staff to help these students especially with the varying mental health needs. Funding and timing is a major factor, therefore more inset days are needed.
attributes.additional_details: 1 in 4 of us are diagnosed with a MH illness at some point. 50% off these diagnosed needs are displayed at the age of 14. Semh schools deal with a lot of these students that display these needs alongside other needs. To help these students and to give them the best they deserve, it should be mandatory that EVERY member of staff is MHFA trained to recognise and deal with students that are in crisis. These members of staff are the early help for most of these students.

attributes.action: Jeremy Hunt to make full apology for comparing the EU and Soviet Union
attributes.background: The foreign secretary, Jeremy Hunt, has been rebuked by the European Commission for a speech at the Conservative party conference where he seemed to compare the European Union to the Soviet Union. Such remarks are damaging to Britain as a nation and particularly so coming from the Foreign Secretary.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2018/oct/01/jeremy-hunt-draws-eu-ire-over-soviet-prison-comparison

attributes.action: Reclassify the antihistamine fexofenadine hydrochloride from POM to P.
attributes.background: There should be greater availability of more powerful antihistamines which can help to reverse the allergic reaction process in the very early stages. Fexofenadine hydrochloride is available at pharmacies in many European countries, UAE, Japan and Australia.
attributes.additional_details:
According to Medicines and Healthcare Products Regulatory Agency (May, 2016) as part of a freedom of information request, the drug remains as classified as a prescription only medicine (POM) in the UK.
Many deaths could be prevented as a result of reclassification to P, where the drug can be made more accessible by being issued under the supervision of a pharmacist.

attributes.action: Make vaccinating children a legal requirement to enrol at a school.
attributes.background: Many parents are misinformed about the risks of vaccines, for example the misconception that the MMR jab causes autism. This is causing an increase in preventable diseases which is unacceptable. Immunisation should NOT be a choice, but a legal requirement in order to enrol a child at a school.
attributes.additional_details: I call on the government to consider making it a legal requirement that all parents immunise their children before they can enrol them at a school. I ask that the government takes into account the rise of the “anti-vaxxers” movement and the damaging effects it is having on not only our children, but the rise of preventable diseases. Cases of measles, mumps and rubella have been rising in the UK which is completely unacceptable in this day and age. The government needs to take action immediately.

attributes.action: Legislate that all goods from the EU must be clearly labelled as such.
attributes.background: People should be able to exercise the freedom to boycott EU goods in protest at the disgraceful behaviour of the EU towards the UK.  We should be able to choose to boycott ANY goods originating in the EU by a simple check of origin. "Made in the EU" should be clearly displayed.

attributes.action: Introduce a Rolling road tax exemption for vehicles over 30 years old.
attributes.background:
The classic car market is booming, it would make it even more desirable, if classic cars became tax exempt after 30 years.
Fair's fair, they have already contributed a huge amount to the tax purse.
attributes.additional_details:
Classic and very collectable cars, are usually incredibly well looked after and cherished. 
It is very important to keep our motoring heritage alive.
The introduction of this tax exemption would be of a huge benifit.

attributes.action: Make government consultants more transparent
attributes.background: Make it a legal requirement that any organization wishing to enter into consultancy with Government undergo full Parliamentary scrutiny by select committee and a full declaration of all their funding sources.
attributes.additional_details:
It has become increasingly apparent that organisations with sources of dark money have penetrated British politics without any scrutiny or accountability. 
In order to fully retake control of Parliament’s Sovereignty, any future influence from independent consultancies should be subject to the most thorough of screening processes. 
In order to rebuild our broken democracy there must be a move towards openness and transparency.

attributes.action: Abolish passport fee for women who change their name on marriage
attributes.background: I remarried and took my husband’s surname. I have to pay a full passport fee for changing my name. This fee doesn’t exist for driving licenses. This fee should be abolished so that all women can travel with their married names without additional cost.

attributes.action: Enact Mandatory Reporting Legislation.
attributes.background: Mandatory Reporting is vital to protect children trapped in the silence of the abusive experience. Without it children will continue to be abused and doctors may feel unable to initiate concern. It will protect healthcare professionals by making it an offence NOT to report reasonable suspicion.
attributes.additional_details: In 2015 the Children’s Commissioner estimated that 1.3 million children will be sexually abused by their 18th birthday; only 1 in 8 receiving a Statutory response that is “largely disclosure led”, when a child speaks out rather than a doctor initiating concern.

attributes.action: Revoke the effective ban on Onshore Wind Turnines
attributes.background: The U.K. has en ecological debt day of the 30th April: the day on which the entire sustainable limit of resources for an entire year have been consumed. The current planning constraints on wind turbines prevent renewable power generation that could greatly contribute to increasing our sustainability
attributes.additional_details: Although intermittent, wind power could contribute massively to the grid - with a single turbine generating power for 1500 homes. 76% of the population are not against turbines - so why are they being blocked? Concerns over bird deaths are disproportionate since over 160,000 turbines would be needed to kill the name number as domestic cats annually (RSPB data). In context, this number of turbines would produce 14 times the amount of energy needed by the U.K. every year: over 490GW of energy.

attributes.action: Fund housing support for people who live with a mentally ill family member.
attributes.background: It can be very difficult to live with a mentally ill relative. It can make it very hard to live normally, work, undertake education, etc. It can be impossible to get sleep, which can make it hard when someone has a job interview or needs to see their child.
attributes.additional_details: In a nutshell, the Government should fund some housing support to provide some respite, even if it's providing full or partial payment for a flatshare.

attributes.action: Acid attacks in the UK are at a rise, the Government should deter these attacks.
attributes.background: Acid attacks are at a rise within the United Kingdom, not enough is being done to deter these threats and violent crimes, therefore we are suggesting for the Government and Policing Services to validate the following: tougher prison sentences, tougher laws for purchase, increased education/research.
attributes.additional_details:
We believe the Government should implement:

- Tougher laws and Prison Sentences with a minimum of 18 years and maximum of 60
- ID will be needed to purchase chemicals
- Tax will be added to chemical purchases
- Chemicals over 30% will need a 'special ID' which is not handed to 
convicted individual(s)
- Education and research is increased
- Purchases should only be allowed to be made digitally by Credit Card for Police print
- Information of chemical purchases should be handled to the Police

attributes.action: Kids can drive at the age of 16
attributes.background:
If this goes into place then kids won't need a excuse for being late to school /college and will be able to travel to school then take transport which
1.won't be as packed which will cause less arguments/ fights
2.will also give kids experience for jobs in the future.

attributes.action: Begin a root and branch review to overhaul the UK's current political system
attributes.background:
We are proud that the UK is the 'mother' of parliaments but as has been shown during the Brexit process. She is no longer effective or efficient in serving its people.

We ask for an independent, root and branch review of the current political system here in the UK to make it better.

attributes.action: Fund free transport for 16-22 year olds.
attributes.background: Transport for students is very expensive and in rural areas, it is too expensive to get to college or school. This potentially stops people from doing jobs that they want to do because they can't get there.

attributes.action: Counselling and support should be provided for those who commit crimes early on.
attributes.background: This is for our citizenship GCSE campaign and we strongly believe that if changes were made, then crimes within the youth would be significantly reduced.
attributes.additional_details:
In the year 2017,  4,315,500 crimes were recorded. 
74,784 were the arrests of young children and the youth. 
On average a custodial sentenced youth sentence length would be around 16 months long.
13,500 youth cautions were given to young people throughout the UK.
We believe that if we can read signs and tackle them with suitable guidance then we will be able to reduce these numbers and hopefully provide a better future for the next generation.
With proper support, counselling and guidance from the government real changes can be made. Help create sustainable futures for OUR youth.

attributes.action: Make it compulsary to put food miles on packaging
attributes.background: When I was shopping I saw that English potatoes cost 10p more than egyptian ones. It then occurred to me the distance they had travelled (probably by air) and thought for 10p I can reduce the pollution created by importing goods. If food miles on packaging we can all make informed decisions.

attributes.action: Amend Universal Credit regulations so it can cover 53 week periods
attributes.background: Universal Credit (UC) is paid monthly to Landlords. If rent is paid weekly, the monthly rate is worked out by multiplying the weekly rent by 52, then dividing by 12.
attributes.additional_details:
However, every 5-7 years some landlords charge for 53 weeks! So UC Claimants lose out 1 whole week of rent! This is unfair to Claimants and Landlords!
 
I quote from UC website: "Universal Credit will always be calculated based on a 52 week year, unless rent is charged over fewer than 52 weeks".
 
https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/universal-credit-and-rented-housing--2/universal-credit-and-rented-housing-guide-for-landlords
 
This issue has been raised a few times directly with Universal Credit, but they are adamant they will only pay for 52 weeks! This needs to be raised for a discussion by the Parliament. Help me reach 100,000 signs!

attributes.action: Make MPs vote by secret ballot in Parliament
attributes.background: When we hold a General Election, a Local Election, a Referendum or when a union holds a strike ballot, voting is done by secret ballot, to remove intimidation. We should insist on nothing less for our MPs, to allow them to vote with their consciences and best judgement, and to prevent intimidation.
attributes.additional_details:
The Brexit debates in Parliament have shown, time and again, that party leaders can, and do, influence the way their MPs vote.
 
If all Parliamentary votes were by secret it would empower Parliament to actually be our Supreme lawmaking body, and prevent Governments from sidelining it

attributes.action: Hard Remain: Align with other EU countries and adopt Schengen and the euro.
attributes.background: Many people are unhappy with the various varieties of brexit that are on the table. But many are also unhappy with the current membership of the EU. Another option would be for a "hard remain". The UK should become part of the Schengen area, adopt the euro currency, and adopt EU driving standards.

attributes.action: Remove Foundation and Higher GCSE papers and have the same paper for everyone.
attributes.background: We feel as though we are being set up for failure as we are not even able to achieve a 6 in a foundation paper when we know we could achieve higher than a 4/5
attributes.additional_details: we think it’s unequal and not fair that other students get a higher opportunity of success therefor we know we probably would not be able to do so well in the higher paper so we believe the test should include foundation and higher paper questions combined into one science and maths should be the same so that everyone has the same chance.

attributes.action: 65% majority referendum to approve the offer to leave EU or else stay in the EU
attributes.background:
Lisbon Treaty Art 50 in effect needs 65% of remaining population to approve a state leaving. Therefore 65% of population leaving should approve
UK Companies Act 2006: 75% vote to change rules that govern its conduct with members. We are considering the relationship between the UK and its citizens
attributes.additional_details:
2016 Referendum result: Leave 17,410,742 – 51.89%; Remain 16,141,241- 48.11% – just 3.78% in favour.  This has been, and continues to be, a most divisive and disproportionate margin for the well being of the UK and its citizens

When the 2016 referendum was taken the campaign was generalised slogans and proclamations and could not clearly set out specific consequences and realities: which were at the time impossible to know. Now we know them

To end division and animosity we need clear majority

attributes.action: Funding/ Installation of Wildlife Crossings (Eco Bridges)
attributes.background: We should be funding safe alternatives for animals to pass over or under our busy dangerous roads. We build these roads through their habitats and offer nothing to prevent thousands of animals deaths occurring each year. Something must be done to help protect our struggling wildlife population.
attributes.additional_details:
Examples of successful Eco Bridges are in The Netherlands (over 66 crossings), Australia, Germany, California, Florida, Canada and many more. All have been successful in increasing numbers in wildlife.
The 4 ways that roads negatively impact wildlife: 1 decrease in habitat, 2 increase mortality due to wildlife-vehicle collisions, 3 prevent access to resources on the other side of the road, and 4 they subdivide wildlife populations into smaller and more vulnerable sub-populations.

attributes.action: Recognise in DWP assessments that depression and anxiety are debilitating
attributes.background: I suffer severe depression and anxiety, yet the DWP deem me to be fit for work. I have been refused every benefit I've applied for based on a medical assessment in 2015. I'm certain there are thousands of others in similar positions.
attributes.additional_details: The Government should ensure medical assessments recognise the impact of these illness when assessing peoples’ fitness to work.

attributes.action: Increase funding for mental health services and accommodation for veterans
attributes.background: Thousands of ex-military personnel are currently either homeless or suffering with mental health issues. It is diabolical that people who have served this country are being left behind in such a manner; it is high time for the government to start actively tackling this crisis.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/least-13000-hero-soldiers-left-11847000

https://www.bbc.com/news/health-45761546

attributes.action: Introduce Knife crime awareness/first aid workshops into schools.
attributes.background: As I write this petition 119 people have died this year of violent crimes, a huge percentage of the deaths have been to knife crime. Children should be educated on the dangers of knif crime, the consequences of carrying a knife, more importantly what to do in a situation If confronted by a knife.
attributes.additional_details:
London knife crime unfortunately is spiralling out of control and sadly most effected are young people. In a recent report it was mentioned how Children may be more vulnerable to becoming a stabbing victim on their way home from school.

Schools, should tackle these issues, have awareness classes, what to say? What to do? When confronted by someone with a knife. First aid courses, knowing vital organs, consequences of carrying a knife and much more.

attributes.action: Change divorce law to protect assets (financial settlement)
attributes.background: You marry a person, not their bank account/assets. When you divorce your money should stay with you and NOT be split 50:50 as a starting point. No-one ever marries with a 50:50 input so the divorce should let you keep what's yours. Only exception: Kids should be cared for equally by both parties.
attributes.additional_details: The law should change to help hard working people keep what's theirs to begin with!! Please sign the petition and drive this change!

attributes.action: Government to ban the production and use of all non-recyclable plastic by 2020.
attributes.background: Plastic is choking each and every one of us.  It has filled the land, sea and air. We may not want to accept it but it is in our face. We would like the government to take the initiative to stop the production so it is not available for use in UK and other countries will follow.
attributes.additional_details:
A Roadmap for Sustainability report found more than 60 countries have introduced bans which are one of the most effective ways to reduce the use of disposable plastic.
Plastic items can take up to 1000 years to decompose in landfills. But plastic bags we use in our everyday life take 10-1000 years to decompose, burning it is not an option as well as it releases toxic fumes into the air.
UN warned at current levels the earth could be awash with 12 billion tonnes of plastic trash by the middle of the century.

attributes.action: Require retailers to disclose the factories in which their products are made
attributes.background: With the fashion industry being the second biggest polluter in the world - we need to hold our high street brands to account. These companies contract out the production of their clothes to factories in third world countries. Sign this to pressure companies into providing full disclosure.

attributes.action: Make all UK schools take GCSEs
attributes.background:
If you attend a state school now, you must take GCSEs 9-1. But if you are more privileged and go to a private school, you can take IGCSEs. 
IGCSEs can be easier than the new GCSEs 9-1 but are considered as equal levels of education. Should the rich be able to pay for easier qualifications?
attributes.additional_details:
Take English Literature for example, at IGCSE level, it's not totally closed book and you have the option to have 40% coursework. Not to mention the added 20% mark for speaking! Whereas at GCSE 9-1 level, exams are worth 100% of your grade and it's fully closed book - you must remember lots of quotes. 

Surely everyone has the right to take equal tests for equal qualifications?

http://everythingenglisheducation.co.uk/everything-english-education-gcse-reforms-igcse-versus-gcse-guess-who-wins/”

attributes.action: Close the legal loopholes in the High Hedges legislation
attributes.background: Part 8 of the Anti-Social Behaviour Act 2003 introduced legislation to combat the scourge of fast-growing evergreens like Leylandii which, when planted in a line as a hedge has blighted the lives of those living in neighbouring properties.
attributes.additional_details: A high hedge is defined as two or more evergreens, more that 2m tall planted in a line and where the branches meet so as to provide a barrier to light. Enforcement of high hedges legislation is the responsibility of councils.  However, the legislation does not cover individual trees and therefore people are merely cutting gaps in their hedges so that the former hedge becomes a line of individual trees which despite being large, cannot be dealt with by councils under the high hedges legislation.

attributes.action: Reduce tax on smoking tobbaco
attributes.background: Make it cheaper. It’s a choice people have.

attributes.action: Zero VAT on low sugar snacks for kids/adults <5g/100g.
attributes.background:
The UK is full of high sugar snacks and is suffering an Obesity epidemic- why are VAT Free Junk foods are allowed?
High sugar treats must be VAT rated. VAT should be zero rated for healthy snacks for children/adults  eg. roasted nuts, raisins, frozen yoghurt, protein bars and diabetic chocolate.
attributes.additional_details:
1 in 5 kids are obese by the time they leave primary school! This leads to more issues, e.g. low self-esteem, health/welfare issues.
1 in 13 deaths relate to obesity
Who Is Obese in the UK?
66% Adults
25% 2-10 year olds
33% 11-15 year olds

The NHS in England spent £6.1 billion on overweight and obesity-related ill-health in 2014 to 15. We spend more each year on the treatment of obesity and diabetes than we do on the police, fire service and judicial system combined.The overall cost of obesity to the wider society is estimated at £27 billion.
https://publichealthmatters.blog.gov.uk/2017/03/31/health-matters-obesity-and-the-food-environment/

The VAT free status on any high sugary foods/ snacks/ treats has to stop. 
VAT on healthy foods has to be made VAT free.

attributes.action: Pass a law restricting the promotion and display of alcoholic beverages in shops
attributes.background: Shops must be more responsible by not displaying alcoholic beverages at the front of the shop where people are forced to pass by it. They should limit the use of promotional marketing so as not to encourage people to purchase alcohol, particularly vulnerable & disadvantaged people in society.
attributes.additional_details: Thousands die from alcohol-related diseases every year. The cost and burden on the NHS is vast. It is the second biggest preventable killer behind smoking. The negative impact of alcohol is worse than smoking because it takes away a persons dignity, self esteem and ruins the lives of family and loved ones. Banning advertising of cigarettes has reduced smoking-related illness. Alcohol should be no different. For example, Tesco should not be having a 'Drinks Festival' a campaign encouraging people to drink.

attributes.action: Lower the legal age for buying alcohol and tobacco to 16 years old
attributes.background: Currently, students and under 18's nationwide are breaking the law in order to have a good time. Attempting to buy alcohol and tobacco under the age of 18 can lead to the criminalisation of young people.
attributes.additional_details: There are already approximately 136,500+ under 18's smoking on a daily basis. Being unable to buy alcohol and tobacco has not discouraged them and the added risk of under 18's joining the "wrong crowd" can lead them to further crime in their future life.

attributes.action: Put Fencing on the GCSE PE Syllabus as a sport option.
attributes.background: Fencing is multiple sport, healthy,fun, it is for all ages from 6 . Teach respect, friendship, win and lose, make good fitness and strong souls!
attributes.additional_details: Put Fencing on the GCSE PE Syllabus as a sport option.The current GCSE PE syllabus does not allow Fencing as a sport option either individually or as a team. It is discriminatory and grossly unfair on the thousands of fencers who spend 15 hours or more each week training and can not use their chosen sport for a GCSE option.

attributes.action: Every life Matters too - Mandatory Custodial Sentences for assaults of any kind
attributes.background:
"Every journey matters to the Mayor of London and TFL" - Well, How about a more important slogan of "Every life Matters too" and resolve the lawlessness in this country too!
 
We need tougher Policing and tougher Sentencing for all assaults of any kind, whether on the streets or inside prisons.
attributes.additional_details:
ALL proven assaults of any kind, on civilians and civil servants alike, should be met with an automatic custodial sentence and all such sentences should be served consecutively, not concurrently, to any other sentences, if any.
 
Sentencing should after all be a real deterrent against assault and abuse, not just a mere distraction.
 
Every life matters.

attributes.action: Make everyone with a life time disability mental or physical have life time pip
attributes.background: It's completely unfair that people with life time disability mental or physical have to repeatedly go through forms, face to face interviews, mandatory considerations and tribunals. It's mentally draining and unfair to repeatedly go through this when it's a life time illness you have.

attributes.action: Make it Law to have all Cats Microchipped by 8 weeks, like with Dogs
attributes.background:
It's a legal requirement to have any dog over the age of eight week microchipped and to keep your details up-to-date, let’s make it the same with cats

Microchipping your pet gives them the best chance of being identified and returned to you if they become lost or stolen.
attributes.additional_details:
Thousands of pets are lost every year and many are never reunited with their owners – microchipping can help to change that.
While collars and tags can get caught or removed – microchipping identifies your pet permanently and effectively.

attributes.action: Introduce terms of service for MPs
attributes.background: Since the 2016 referendum, voters have been dismayed by the way in which some MPs have been unwilling to uphold the referendum result. To prevent future ambiguity, terms of service should be introduced and included in manifestos.
attributes.additional_details: Having clear terms of service, associated with a job description, would provide clarity for what is, or is not, expected in their role as MP. This clarity is particularly important for public servants. The UK Government and Parliament have a duty to ensure the public have confidence in those they elect. It should be made clear within the manifesto when an elected politician would express personal views, constituents' views or, in the case of a referendum, the views of the UK public.

attributes.action: The 1 to 9 grade scheme for GCSE should be changed back to A* to G.
attributes.background: There is no need to have 1 to 9 instead of A* to G, as everyone is used to, and understands, the old system. Using A* to G will also help to let students compare their achievements with their parents, their older siblings, or anyone who took an exam before the system was changed.

attributes.action: Cap private housing rent based on the house value
attributes.background:
Private housing rent costs are through the roof!! No longer is it affordable to cover rent and have money spare for millions of people in the UK.
Landlords in the UK are making it impossible for low paid workers to get a better future for their family.
attributes.additional_details:
What's suggested is a Maximum cap based on the house value, most importantly low value housing costing under £250,000. A maximum rent of £500 per month is more than sufficient for the landlord to not only cover costs but still very profitable.
This WILL help millions of people in the UK better off and have a better living standard.

attributes.action: Eliminate the effects of the use of single-use plastic in takeaway restaurants.
attributes.background: We are a group of sixth form students who are highly concerned with the use of single-use plastics. This is because it uses fossil fuels, is non- biodegradable and pollutes our oceans resulting in the killing of animals and disruption of food chains.
attributes.additional_details: We are increasingly worried about the future of our planet, with plastic contributing to a huge carbon footprint. We want to eliminate the use of unnecessary plastic in takeaways nationally.

attributes.action: Allow gritting lorries to use blue lights during snow emergencies.
attributes.background: New technology is now available for dual colour LEDs that can have 2 colours, I propose that gritting lorries/ snow ploughs be fitted with Amber / blue lights so during periods on snowfall, gritting lorries can switch to blue lights to make it mandatory to move out the way and allow them to pass.
attributes.additional_details:
I have previously been stuck behind a plough in heavy snow sitting in traffic because because would not move out the way. The driver got out and told around 10 cars to move over, he then gave up as others were just sitting there, in the end we was all stuck for over 4 hours including the gritting lorry.
The new LEDS could have Amber on normal conditions with the ability to switch to blue when required as vehicles would have to allow them to pass to clear the road ahead
